statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Xavier 99, St. Bonaventure 71
article.story: CINCINNATI (AP) -- Brian Thornton had 19 points and 10 rebounds to lead fast-starting Xavier to a 99-71 victory over St. Bonaventure on Saturday. Thornton, a transfer from Vanderbilt who topped 1,000 career points in the game, led five Musketeers in double figures. Josh Duncan scored 13 points, Justin Doellman had 11 points and eight rebounds, Stanley Burrell scored 11 and Johnny Wolf had 10 points and five assists. The Musketeers had a season-high 30 assists on 36 field goals to shoot 53.7 percent from the field. Xavier (9-2, 2-0 Atlantic 10) won its fourth straight game and shot 12-for-19 from 3-point range in scoring its most points this season. St. Bonaventure (6-7, 0-2) lost its third game in a row while shooting a season-high 43.9 percent against a Xavier defense ranked ninth in the nation. The Musketeers came in allowing 55.6 points a game. Paul Williams scored 18 points and had 10 rebounds for the Bonnies. Ahmad Smith, the Bonnies' leading scorer at 17.1 points per game, scored 11, and Tyler Relph added 13. Xavier opened the game with a 16-4 run on the way to a 40-32 halftime lead. The Musketeers outscored the Bonnies 59-39 in the second half, shooting 65 percent from the field. The loss was St. Bonaventure's fifth in a six-game road trip.
